Larry Bird

Indiana Pacers

Transaction BPM over Tenure

Grade Report

Draft Rating:

C-

Larry Bird ranks in the 43th percentile for drafting among executives in our database. Bird's draft picks average out to be worth the equivalent of 3 spots lower than they were picked due to their terrible drafting.
Some of their biggest wins:
  • Drafted Paul George with 10th pick but was worth 1th pick.
  • Drafted Danny Granger with 17th pick but was worth 4th pick.
  • Drafted Joe Young with 43th pick but was worth 28th pick.
Some of their biggest busts:
  • Drafted Tyler Hansbrough with 13th pick but was worth 44th pick.
  • Drafted Solomon Hill with 23th pick but was worth 47th pick.
  • Drafted Shawne Williams with 17th pick but was worth 43th pick.

Trade Rating:

D-

Larry Bird ranks in the 23th percentile for trading among executives in our database.
Their biggest win:
  • Added Ike Diogu, Mike Dunleavy, Keith McLeod, Troy Murphy to IND.
  • Lost Al Harrington, Stephen Jackson, Šarūnas Jasikevičius, Josh Powell to GSW.
Their biggest L:
  • Added George Hill to IND.
  • Lost Dāvis Bertāns, Kawhi Leonard, Erazem Lorbek to SAS.

Signing Rating:

C

Larry Bird ranks in the 49th percentile for free agency signings among executives in our database. That's basically average. It could be worse though lol.
Their best signings:
  • Signed David West in 2011.
  • Signed David West in 2013.
  • Signed C.J. Watson in 2013.
Their worst signings:
  • Signed Dahntay Jones in 2009.
  • Signed Monta Ellis in 2015.
  • Signed Earl Watson in 2009.
